title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: As Energy Department prioritizes AI and fusion, basic research faces squeeze
items.description: Reorganization could shift mission of the United States’s largest funder of the physical sciences

items.title: Brain’s ‘plumbing’ inspires new Alzheimer’s strategies—and controversial surgeries
items.description: Animal studies support idea that boosting fluid clearance could blunt neurological disorders

items.title: Seeking greater independence, Europe boosts space agency budget
items.description: X-ray observatory and mission to Saturn’s moon Enceladus win as ESA’s science program sees growth

items.title: How some treatments can lead to a ‘functional cure’ for HIV
items.description: Specific class of immune cells help keep virus at bay for months or years—even in the absence of drugs

items.title: ‘Game changer’: System to track small animals from space takes flight—again
items.description: The project lost its data stream in 2022 after the war in Ukraine began

items.title: Antiviral drug abandoned by pharma shows promise against dengue
items.description: A daily pill can prevent the crippling disease, but its maker won’t bring it to market

items.title: Artificial ‘nose’ tells people when certain smells are present
items.description: Technology that uses a less known sensory system to substitute for olfaction could one day help anosmic people detect some odors

items.title: ‘Superarm’ helps male octopuses deliver sperm to females
items.description: Specialized appendage responds to female sex hormones, allowing males to find sex organs in the dark

items.title: Russia’s plan for ‘colossal’ science spending boost faces skepticism
items.description: Government pledges to more than triple research spending by 2030

items.title: A puzzling, 3.4-million-year-old fossil foot belonged to a contemporary of the famed Lucy
items.description: Identity of the toe bones and other fossils could shake up the human family tree
